conclusion: Analyze the motion of the ball as it swings around point O and find the force exerted on the rod when the ball reaches the highest point P.
The slider is locked (no horizontal movement)
The ball starts with the rod in horizontal position
Using conservation of energy to find velocity at the highest point P
Initial kinetic energy: 0.5 * m * v0^2 = 0.5 * 1 * 4^2 = 8 J
Potential energy at highest point: mgh = 1 * 10 * 0.5 = 5 J
Final kinetic energy at highest point: 0.5 * v_P^2 = 3 J
Velocity at highest point P: v_P = sqrt(6) ≈ 2.45 m/s
Centripetal force at point P: F_centripetal = mv_P^2 / L = 12 N
Gravitational force at point P: F_g = mg = 10 N
Total force exerted by the ball on the rod: F_total = F_centripetal + F_g = 22 N
Direction of total force: downward along the rod from P to O
Final answer: Magnitude of force is 22 N, directed downward along the rod (from P toward O)
